name: Kio Flying Frog
description: A slender frog, green dorsally and yellow ventrally. It has long toes with adhesive pads and webbing. Its slit-like pupil is horizontal.
spread_note: Southern Asia – Cambodia, Vietnam, southern China, India, Laos, Thailand
image_alt: Kio flying frog, photo: Petr Velenský, Prague Zoo
reproduction: During breeding, it builds a foam nest in the tree canopy overhanging water. Newly hatched tadpoles drop into the water to complete development.
attractions: This peculiar tree frog boasts a unique skill shared by all flying frogs: when needing to move quickly between trees, it leaps into the air, spreads its legs wide, and extends the webbing between its toes like small parachutes to slow its fall. It adjusts flight direction by shifting leg positions and can even turn to face backward mid-air.
projects_note: Listed as vulnerable on the IUCN Red List. It requires tropical forests with continuous canopies, and as these diminish, its populations become fragmented.
breeding: Prague Zoo has kept these frogs since 2012.
